Description: Shoulder sherd of East Greek pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora or oinochoe; dull cream slip; exterior: part of tongue frieze; below, broken cable pattern between black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The tongues are probably vertical, not pendant; parallels are either earlier and South Ionian of c.650-30, or a little later and perhaps Tean (by analysis; Vase Wild Goat p. 87).
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 2, pl. 3, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.050)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
